document:
The WorldEdit documentation widely applies to FAWE too, you can find it here: https://worldedit.enginehub.org/en/latest/api/index.html

We suggest that FAWE operations are completed asynchronously. Using FAWE API from the main thread is likely to block the main thread if FAWE is used correctly. (and the other methods) are blocking, as is so anything you want to happen after an edit, place after closing the EditSession with close(), try-with-resources, etc. Always ensure EditSessions are closed before doing anything else, and that you do not reuse EditSessions else changes may not necessarily be flushed to the world.

If you are looking for snapshots, add the repository of S01 OSS Sonatype to the repositories' block.

After a world has been unloaded, and then reloaded trying to run some commands like yields the following error...

 

 Even though that world is actually currently loaded and should be accessible.

The easiest way to replicate this is to use Multiverse-Core ( https://dev.bukkit.org/projects/multiverse-core ).

 Create a new world using , unload the world using , load the world again using , then try using FAWE in that world... when you go to undo something it'll give you the error above.

Plugins being used on the server:
‚Ä¢ I included all information required in the sections above
‚Ä¢ I made sure there are no duplicates of this report (Use Search)
‚Ä¢ I made sure I am using an up-to-date version of FastAsyncWorldEdit for 1.15.2
‚Ä¢ I made sure the bug/error is not caused by any other plugin

Hello. This is a bug report or improvement request for the ability to logging changes in FastAsyncWorldEdit to CoreProtect.

I am using FastAsyncWorldEdit and CoreProtect. I copied the block and pasting the copy does not logging it in CoreProtect.

 A video of this phenomenon actually occurring was taken and is attached below.
‚Ä¢ Build a PaperMC server and add the CoreProtect and FastAsyncWorldEdit jar files to the plugins.
‚Ä¢ Modify the configuration file with reference to the following #Configuration.
‚Ä¢ Login to the server and grant yourself an operator.
‚Ä¢ Place any block. (And check that there is an placed record for the blocks placed)
‚Ä¢ Paste what you just copied elsewhere:
‚Ä¢ No error logs are output to the server log and no placed logs are logged in CoreProtect.

# Don't bug console when these plugins slow down WorldEdit operations # - You'll see a message in console or ingame if you need to change this option allowed-plugins: # Should debug messages be sent when third party extents are used? debug: true

This edit is set to facilitate checking the operation and is not required for reproduction. (The default setting is fine)

I look forward to your reply.

A Minecraft Map Editor... that runs in-game!

With selections, schematics, copy and paste, brushes, and scripting.

Use it in creative, or use it temporarily in survival.



Java Edition required.

Compatible with Bukkit-based platforms (Spigot and Paper).





 With selections, schematics, copy and paste, brushes, and scripting.Use it in creative, or use it temporarily in survival.Java Edition required.Compatible with Bukkit-based platforms (Spigot and Paper).

1. Set up a Bukkit server such as 

2. Download WorldEdit from this page (see the Files tab above for all versions).

3. Put the WorldEdit plugin file into your plugins folder.



Check YouTube for tutorials, or read the official 



We also recommend WorldGuard and CraftBook!

Download WorldEdit from this page (see the Files tab above for all versions).3. Put the WorldEdit plugin file into your plugins folder.Check YouTube for tutorials, or read the official documentation ‚ö†Ô∏è Forge or Fabric users: Download the WorldEdit mod . ‚ö†Ô∏è Sponge users: Download the WorldEdit Sponge plugin



WorldEdit has NO impact on your server when installed.

It only affects your server when you use a command.

 

 

 

 WorldEdit hason your server when installed.It only affects your server when you use a command.





Only opped users or users with permissions supplied with a permissions plugin can use WorldEdit.



 How do you use WorldEdit? 

To learn how to use WorldEdit, 





You may visit our

 Only opped users or users with permissions supplied with a permissions plugin can use WorldEdit.To learn how to use WorldEdit, read the docs . Check YouTube for tutorials too!You may visit our documentation or Discord Guild Visit our issue tracker . However, if you just have a question, please try one of the methods above.Visit our GitHub repository . WorldEdit is licensed under GPLv3 and you can compile it with Gradle.

If no commands work, it may because WorldEdit failed to start:
‚Ä¢ None Make sure that you are running Bukkit/Forge/Sponge/etc. A vanilla minecraft server will not load plugins/mods!
‚Ä¢ None You can run a command such as (Bukkit), (Sponge) or (Forge) to ensure your server is running proper software. In single-player, the Main Menu should have a ‚ÄúMods‚Äù button (and WorldEdit should be in the list!).
‚Ä¢ None Make sure that you have the proper version of WorldEdit for your version of Minecraft. If those solutions do not help you, you will need to look through your startup log:
‚Ä¢ None If you use a game server host, use its log viewer.
‚Ä¢ None You can also open up ‚Äúlatest.log‚Äù in the logs folder of your server directory. (On older versions of Minecraft, the log file was ‚Äúserver.log‚Äù in the root directory.) If you are unable to discover the problem from reading the server log, you can ask for help or submit a bug report. How old is WorldEdit?¬∂ WorldEdit began in September 2010 for the ‚ÄúhMod‚Äù modding platform by sk89q. Later on, WorldEdit was ported to Bukkit, and eventually to Forge and other platforms. WorldEdit has been developed by many people, and large portions of WorldEdit include contributed code. The list of top contributors can be found on GitHub.

Commands all return ‚Äú0 blocks changed‚Äù even though they should be changing.¬∂ If you‚Äôve previously set a global mask with , you‚Äôll have to clear it again with so it no longer masks your edits. My server crashes when I do large edits (1 million blocks or more)!¬∂ If your client is disconnected / timed out, these instructions will not fix that. At this time, WorldEdit does not attempt to keep clients connected while processing edits. These instructions only allow for the server to actually complete the edit. The two most likely causes for this are either the watchdog crashing your server, or it running out of memory. Ensure that you allocate approximately 1 gigabyte (for the general server) + 2 gigabytes for every ten million blocks you are editing. For example, if you‚Äôre editing around 50 million blocks, divide to get , then add to get 11 gigabytes. To allocate this amount to your server, specify . See these example instructions for Bukkit/Spigot/Paper. They also apply in a similar way to NeoForge/Fabric. To fix the watchdog crashing the server, try increasing the watchdog timeout for your server. For Spigot/Paper, this is in the file. For NeoForge/Fabric, it is in the file. This should not be needed in most cases, however, as WorldEdit already ticks the watchdog automatically. My client crashes when I do large edits (1 million blocks or more) in single-player!¬∂ You can use the same instructions as the server case above, but you don‚Äôt need to worry about the watchdog. Single-player does not use a watchdog. How do I remove a tool/brush from the item I‚Äôm holding?¬∂ Use the or command while holding the item. These are both currently the same command, so it doesn‚Äôt matter which one you pick. On all versions of WorldEdit, you need to have the permission (which can be granted through OP) in order to set block entities. On Bukkit servers, WorldEdit has to use some version-specific adapters to get full access to many functions due to how Bukkit works. It uses these adapters for block entities (blocks that use additional data including signs, containers, etc.), entities, and some other functionality. What this generally means is that every new release of Minecraft will require you to update WorldEdit. Usually, WorldEdit will be updated quickly, and you can find new releases or experimental builds via the links on the main page. This is due to a conflict with the Enchantable mod by MrCrayFish, described here. You can either remove the mod, or use the long range wand tool.
